newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central Bank sells $20 mln to calm market.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central Bank sells $20 mln to calm market.

text.p: Philippine Central Bank treasurer Sergio Edeza told Reuters on Thursday the bank had sold $20 million to calm the foreign exchange market after the peso was hit by a false rumour the country's defence chief was killed.
Edeza said the bank may have to undertake more drastic steps if the peso continues to be battered.
"We'll use it (the interest rate) if necessary. We'll just have to wait. I believe it has calmed down actually," he said.
The Central Bank sold dollars at 26.235 pesos in late trading Thursday after the peso was hammered by the rumours.
